Record Class Card

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.dnikitin.poker.common.model.game.Card
Record Components:
rank - The rank of the card (e.g., ACE, KING, TEN).
suit - The suit of the card (e.g., HEARTS, SPADES).
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Card>
public record Card(Rank rank, Suit suit) extends Record implements Comparable<Card>
Represents a standard playing card in a 52-card deck.

Implemented as a Java Record to provide:

  • Immutability (cannot change rank/suit after creation).
  • Automatic equals() and hashCode() implementation.
  • Concise syntax.

Implements Comparable to support automatic sorting (e.g., in a hand).

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(@NonNull @NonNull Card other)
      Compares this card with another card for ordering.

      Ordering logic: 1. Rank (Power) - Higher rank comes first (descending order usually handled by comparator). 2. Suit - Tie-breaker if ranks are equal.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Card>
      Parameters:
      other - The card to compare to.
      Returns:
      A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.

    • compareByPowerOnly

      public int compareByPowerOnly(@NonNull @NonNull Card other)
      Compares cards only based on their Rank power, ignoring suits. Useful for game logic where suits don't affect hand strength (except for Flush).

    • toString

      @NonNull public @NonNull String toString()
      Returns the string representation (e.g., "Ah" for Ace of Hearts).
      Specified by:
      toString in class Record

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
      equals in class Record
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if this object is the same as the o argument; false otherwise.
